ingredients: 1 package gluten-free lasagna noodles (check for soy in ingredients)
instructions: Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions, being careful not to overcook. Drain and set aside.
In a food processor or blender, combine the avocado, purple onion, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy. This is your avocado filling.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the finely chopped white onion and a tablespoon of water. Cook until softened, about 3-5 minutes. Do not brown.

Add the whole milk, spinach, allspice, sugar, and salt and pepper to the saucepan. Simmer for 5 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted and the sauce has thickened slightly. Remove from heat. This is your lemon-onion cream sauce.
Assemble the lasagna: Spread a thin layer of the lemon-onion cream sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Lay a layer of cooked lasagna noodles over the sauce.
Spread a layer of the avocado filling over the noodles.
Pour a layer of the lemon-onion cream sauce over the avocado filling.
Repeat layers: noodles, avocado filling, lemon-onion cream sauce. End with a layer of lemon-onion cream sauce on top.
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the lasagna is heated through and the top is lightly bubbly.
Let the lasagna rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
response.name: Spinach and Avocado Lasagna with Lemon-Onion Cream Sauce (Soy and Gluten-Free)
